data.title: CEO and Board of Directors
meta_keywords: travis credit union board of directors
data.meta_description: The leadership team at Travis Credit Union (TCU) is dedicated to building lifelong relationships with our members to help achieve their financial goals.
data.text:
Deborah has more than 30 years of experience in leadership, operations, and resource management. During her career, she has held executive positions such as Review Board Adjudicator, Physical Disability Board of Review for the Department of Defense (DoD) and Vice President/Area Manager for Kaiser Permanente Health Plan and Medical Centers. During this time, she also served as a Colonel in the U.S. Air Force Reserves/Active Duty and retired with more than 33 years of service.

She also served on the California Military Counsel which advises the governor's office on relevant military issues throughout California. Additionally, Deborah was on the board for St. John Shelter for Women and the Children in Sacramento and the United Way in San Antonio, Texas. She holds a Master’s Degree in Business Administration and a Bachelor’s of Science Degree in Nursing from California State University.

Deborah currently serves as the Travis Credit Union Board Chair and was elected to the Travis Credit Union Board of Directors in 2008. She holds the Certified Credit Union Board Member (CCUB) Designation awarded by Credit Union National Association. Deborah also serves as a board member and chair to the Governance Committee for Paradise Valley Estates, an accredited continuing care community (CCRC).

Close

Kevin is the CEO of Paradise Valley Estates in Fairfield and has more than 30 years of experience in healthcare and the senior housing industry. He is invested in the communities he serves and has helped develop and manage dozens of senior living communities throughout the country.

Throughout his career, Kevin has been a strong proponent of strategic planning, innovation, customer service and team spirit. He is also has a long standing history of creating a positive community culture and improving the organization’s financial performance.

Kevin has a BS and an MBA from the Rochester Institute of Technology and serves on the boards of the Fairfield Community Services Foundation and LeadingAge California.

Close

Mary is a retired Department of Defense civilian leader for the U.S. Air Force. She is well known in the local community and supports non-profits serving youth, Veterans, Wreaths Across America, Women’s Political Advocacy and her church. She’s a Certified Credit Union Volunteer with the Credit Union National Association. As a Travis Credit Union member since 1966, she is very aware of how credit union services were critical during her career. Mary was appointed to the Supervisory Committee in 1995 and served as chair until she was elected to the Board of Directors in 2007. Her dedication to Travis Credit Union members is first and foremost as a board member.

Close

Doug is a retired Air Force Colonel and a retired commercial airline pilot. During his 26 year military career, he flew C-141’s at Travis AFB and served as the 710 MAS Squadron Commander. During his 28 year commercial airline career, he earned multiple Airline Transport Pilot ratings and acquired over 20,000 flight hours.

Doug has been a member of Travis Credit Union since 1970 and is a graduate of the TCU Volunteer at Large program. He is a Certified Credit Union Board member (CCUB) and certified in Financial Planning/Literacy both from CUNA. He was on the Supervisory Committee from 2013-2017 and Chair of the Supervisory Committee from 2016-2017. He was appointed to the Board of Directors in 2017 and now serves as the Board Treasurer and Chair of the Finance Committee.

Doug holds a BA in Biology and has a Master's in Business Administration. He has been a licensed Real Estate Broker since 1976 and was a Real Estate Appraiser for 10 years. Since 2003, he has been a certified Golf Rules Official for the NCGA/NCPGA and is a Past President of the Senior Golf Association of Northern California. He was on the Vacaville Planning Commission from 2018-2022 and has been reappointed for the 2024-2026 term.

Close

Len is a well-known civic leader, serving the area as an elected official and a military commander. As mayor of Vacaville, he worked closely with the City Council and city management to develop policy in all areas of local government, including the city budget, public safety and community development. Len served as vice mayor, city councilmember and city planning commissioner. He also chaired the Travis Regional Armed Forced Committee and led the effort to retain Travis AFB. He helped develop a strategic plan for the city, which included the renewal of Downtown Vacaville.

Len retired as a colonel in the Air Force and was the commander for the 89th Military Airlift Wing Command, responsible for all operations, maintenance, and transportation of the Presidential Wing of the U.S. Air Force, including the safe, reliable operation of Air Force One. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree mechanical engineering from Lehigh University. Len has been on the Board since 2010.

Close

Brian is a Business Unit Planning Coordinator for the CFO of Sacramento Municipal Utility District (SMUD). He has more than 20 years of financial and operational experience working with large state utilities and multinational energy companies. Brian specializes in financial, strategic, and operational planning and performance. His passion lies in forging new paths to the future, particularly through community investment and fostering the growth of small businesses in the communities served by Travis Credit Union.

He earned a Bachelor of Science in Accounting from Sacramento State University and a MBA from Saint Mary’s College. Brian is also a graduate of TCU’s Volunteer at Large program and a native of Vacaville. He joined Travis Credit Union Board of Directors in 2020.

Close

JP is currently General Counsel and Corporate Secretary for Rhombus Systems, Inc., an enterprise cloud-based AI driven physical security solution provider. He has more than 28 years of experience in the technology and healthcare sectors, working with several fortune 500 companies focusing on strategy, product development, data security and privacy, corporate governance, and operations.

JP earned his Bachelors of Science degree in Business Administration from Biola University and his Juris Doctorate from Pepperdine University. He is certified in Entrepreneurship and Technology Law. In his spare time, JP teaches at Pepperdine University’s Caruso School of Law, advises various early-stage technology companies, and serves as an active member of TechGC, a private network consortium of high-growth technology GCs.

JP started volunteering with TCU in 2019. He is a graduate of the TCU Volunteer-at-Large program, and was elected to its Board of Directors in 2020. JP holds the Certified Credit Union Board member designation (CCUB) awarded by Credit Union National Association, has served on TCU’s Governance Committee, Finance Committee, Nominating Committee, Training & Development Committee, and CEO Selection Committee, and currently is the Chair of the Policy Committee.

Close

Tim is currently the Executive Director of the Solano Small Business Development Center serving Solano and Napa County and directs a team of 30 Business Advisors who work to support the success of over 2,000 small businesses.

Previously, he was a Director of Global Sales for FedEx responsible for $1 Billion in revenue and overseeing a global sales force of 300 Account Executives worldwide. Earlier in his career, he started his own firm, Prediction Analytics, providing location and sales forecasting services to national retailers and restaurants including McDonalds, the Gap Stores, Applebee’s, Krispy Kreme and others. The company was sold to Experian Corp within three years of inception.

Tim serves on several boards, including the Advisory Board of the Solano Economic Development Corporation, two faith-based nonprofits, and is an elder and treasurer of Graceway Church in Benicia. Tim holds an Associate Degree from Sierra College. He joined the Travis Credit Union Board of Directors in 2020 and holds the Certified Credit Union Board Member (CCUB) Designation awarded by Credit Union National Association. He is also a Gallup Certified Strengths Coach and works with leaders to maximize their strengths and the strengths of their team members.

Close

Richard has nearly 30 years of experience in law enforcement, serving in the Oakland Police Department for 20 years in various capacities, such as a police officer, undercover narcotics detective, sergeant, lieutenant, captain and Chief of Police. After 20 years in Oakland, he became the Police Chief for Vacaville for nine years before retiring in 2013. He is currently senior police consultant for Citygate Associates, LLC and has taught police courses for both the University of Phoenix and the Los Rios Community College District.

He earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from John F. Kennedy University and a Master's degree in Public Administration from Golden Gate University. Richard joined the Travis Credit Union Board of Directors in 2020. He also serves as a board member for PACE Solano, a local nonprofit that provides services and support to the developmentally disabled.

Close

Tim has more than 30 years of leadership and community service experience. He is currently the president and chief executive officer of Community Resource Associates Inc. in Antioch, where he is responsible for bringing long-term affordable housing to seniors and others in need.

Tim serves on the board of several organizations, including STAND! For Families Free of Violence and Lone Tree Golf and Event Center. He is a past board member and Housing Committee chair for the Pittsburgh Economic & Housing Development Corporation. He earned a Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration from Northwestern Business College. Tim served as a Travis Credit Union board member from 2011-2017 and was reappointed in 2018 as Chair of the Supervisory Committee.

Close

Johanna is a retired CPA with more than 40 years of accounting experience and was a managing partner in the local public accounting firm, Anderson & Associates.

She was appointed to the Travis Credit Union Supervisory Committee in 2007. Following a two-year hiatus, Johanna was appointed to serve the committee again in 2011. She has also served on the board of various non-profit organizations in Vacaville and the Sacramento area. As a long term member of Travis Credit Union, she advocates for the organization to the local community and military. Johanna holds a BS in accounting and a MS in taxation from Golden Gate University.

Close

Kevin is the President and Chief Executive Officer of Travis Credit Union. He has nearly 20 years of experience in the financial services industry and has held a variety of senior and executive roles with national and regional banks. Prior to Travis Credit Union, Kevin was the Chief Growth Officer of a fintech, focused on empowering underserved consumers to improve their credit and financial wellbeing.

Kevin earned Master of Science in Integrated Marketing Communications from Northwestern University and a Bachelor of Arts in Organizational Communications from the University of South Florida. He also serves on the Board of Directors for the Solano Economic Development Corporation and Travis Credit Union Foundation, and is on the Advisory Board for the Global Retail Marketing Association.

Close

Reva is responsible for the Real Estate, Consumer Lending, Business and Commercial Banking, and Servicing and Collections departments, ensuring they align and support Travis Credit Union’s strategic initiatives and priorities. She has nearly 30 years of experience and is known for exponential revenue and equity growth, leveraging new technologies, and creating new product strategies and delivery channels. Her most recent position was Senior Vice President of Consumer and Home Loans at Golden 1 Credit Union, providing leadership in all aspects of lending. Earlier in her career, Reva held leadership positions with Wells Fargo, Prosper Marketplace, and Terafina, Inc.

She earned a Master of Business Administration in Business Finance from the University of Technology in Sydney, Australia and a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Delhi in India. Reva served on the boards the American Red Cross, the Novato Planning Commission, and several alternative theater companies in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Close

As Chief People Officer, Catherine (CJ) is responsible for the strategy and results for Human Resources, Learning & Development, and DEI Engagement programs. She brings more than 30 years of human resources and strategic planning expertise to Travis Credit Union, including organization design and development, performance management, talent management, strategic business, and HR planning. Previous, CJ was the Vice President of Human Resources at the Center for Elders’ Independence in Oakland, a non-profit providing integrated health care services to the frail and elderly.

She earned a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science from the University of Southern Maine. CJ is a board member of the DayBreak Adult Care Centers and a committee member of both the Solano County Behavioral Health Diversity and Equity committee, and the Vallejo Chamber of Commerce Economic Development Committee.

Close

Scott leads the Technology and Enterprise Architecture teams. His overall responsibility is ensuring that Travis Credit Union maximizes investments in technology solutions and develops high standards of performance management and operating integrity. Scott has nearly 30 years of IT experience, including 10 years of working in financial services at Barclays Global Investors and BlackRock. He was instrumental in the M&A process and technology integration of several companies, including BlackRock/Barclays, Allstate/SquareTrade, and SAP/Sybase. Additionally, he has held leadership positions with SquareTrade, Hewlett Packard, and others. He is a native of Vacaville and attended Diablo Valley College.

Close

Herjit leads the Internal Audit operations for Travis Credit Union. Her team provides independent and objective assurance regarding the effectiveness of internal controls, risk management and governance practices throughout the credit union. In addition, she oversees the internal, financial and regulatory audits. Herjit has over 20 years of banking and auditing experience, with more than 16 years of experience at Travis Credit Union.

She earned a Masters of Business Administration from Golden Gate University and a Bachelor of Science in Economics and Finance from California State University of Sacramento.

Close

Mike is responsible for all legal matters related to Travis Credit Union including corporate, regulatory, governance, copyright, intellectual property, and employment law, in addition to supervising our credit and enterprise risk leaders. He has more than 30 years of experience in the legal profession, including serving 20 years as an attorney with the State of California, nine years in private practice, and one year as a volunteer deputy district attorney. Mike’s most recent state service was as Deputy General Counsel for Litigation for the California Department of Insurance, the largest consumer protection agency in California.

He earned his Master of Laws (cum laude) in natural resources and environmental law from Northwestern School of Law - Lewis & Clark College, a Juris Doctorate from the University of San Diego, and a Bachelor of Arts from University of California at Davis. Mike serves as an Appellate Mediator for the Third District-California Court of Appeal, is on the Board of Directors for the Davis Chamber of Commerce, and has recently completed a term on the CFPB’s Credit Union Advisory Council.

Close
